clearcontrol.microscope.timelapse.timer

Interface TimelapseTimerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdaptiveAcquisitionTimer, FixedIntervalTimelapseTimer, TimelapseTimerBase

    public interface TimelapseTimerInterface
    Interface implemented by all timelapse timers
    Author:
    royer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean enoughTimeFor(long pTimeNeeded, long pReservedTime, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit pTimeUnit)
      Returns true if there is enough time to complete a task of given duration before the next time point is due.
      long getAcquisitionInterval(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit pTimeUnit)
      Returns the current acquisition interval in the given time unit
      Variable<TimeUnitEnum> getAcquisitionIntervalUnitVariable()
      Returns acquisition interval unit variable
      Variable<java.lang.Long> getAcquisitionIntervalVariable()
      Returns acquisition interval variable
      Variable<TimeUnitEnum> getActualAcquisitionIntervalUnitVariable()
      Returns actual acquisition interval unit variable
      Variable<java.lang.Long> getActualAcquisitionIntervalVariable()
      Returns actual acquisition interval variable This the last measured interval between the last acquired time point and the one before that.
      long getLastAcquisitionTime(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit pTimeUnit)
      Returns the last acquisition time in the given unit
      void notifyAcquisition()
      Notifies of acquisition.
      void reset()
      Resets the timer
      long timeLeftBeforeNextTimePoint(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit pTimeUnit)
      Returns the time left in the given unit until next time point is due.
      boolean waitToAcquire(long pTimeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit pTimeUnit)
      Waits until next acquisition is due, with a timeout.

      • enoughTimeFor

        default boolean enoughTimeFor(long pTimeNeeded,
                              long pReservedTime,
                              java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit pTimeUnit)
        Returns true if there is enough time to complete a task of given duration before the next time point is due.
        Parameters:
        pTimeNeeded - time needed
        pReservedTime - reserved time
        pTimeUnit - time unit
        Returns:
        true if there is enough time

      • waitToAcquire

        boolean waitToAcquire(long pTimeout,
                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit pTimeUnit)
        Waits until next acquisition is due, with a timeout.
        Parameters:
        pTimeout - timeout
        pTimeUnit - time unit for timeout
        Returns:
        true if succeeded without timeout

      • getLastAcquisitionTime

        Returns the last acquisition time in the given unit
        Parameters:
        pTimeUnit - time unit
        Returns:
        last acquisition time

      • notifyAcquisition

        void notifyAcquisition()
        Notifies of acquisition. This must be called _just_ before the acquistion starts (not after!).
